question: When and where is Maple X Tommy Hacks happening?
answer: It will be happening in December 23rd 2022 - January 7th 2023, it will be completely virtual this year. You can participate in the hackathon from the comfort of your own home or wherever you have access to a stable internet connection. We are planing an in person closing ceremony and details will be shared soon!

question: I don't have an idea/team, what should I do?
answer: No worries! Although hackathons are often a team experience, we welcome solo hackers as well! If youâ€™d like to find a team before the event, we will be hosting a team formation opportunity shortly before the start of the hackathon!

question: Do I have to know how to code beforehand?
answer: Maple X Tommy Hacks presents a valuable opportunity for learning and growth. Experienced mentors will be available for guidance throughout the event.!

question: Can I attend if I live far away?
answer: Yes, you are more than welcome to attend Maple X Tommy Hacks regardless of your location! As the hackathon will be held entirely online this year, you can participate from wherever you have access to a stable internet connection. We have attendees from all over the world participating in the hackathon, and we encourage students from diverse backgrounds and locations to join us.

question: What do I make??
answer: The possibilities are endless at Maple X Tommy Hacks! You can work on any idea or project that you are passionate about. This can be anything from a new app or website, to a hardware project or social impact initiative. We encourage creativity and innovation, and we want you to use this opportunity to build something that you are excited about. You are also welcome to use your own tools and resources to develop your project. Our experienced mentors will be available to provide guidance and support throughout the event

question: How many hackers per team?
answer: Each team at Maple X Tommy Hacks can have up to 4 hackers. We believe that smaller teams are more agile and able to move faster, and we encourage attendees to form teams of 4 or fewer people. However, if you prefer to work on your own, you are welcome to participate as a solo hacker as well.

question: Who is eligible to particpate?
answer: Highschool students across the globe are eligible!
